title: R Markdown: ON YOUR MARKS, GET SET, GO!!
description:
Hello, R enthusiasts!!!
Would you like to analyse your data, share and reproduce your results, All in one go?
Let's do it with R Markdown !!!

Come join us in our upcoming meet-up "R Markdown: On Your Marks, Get Set, GO!!!"

> ? What is R Markdown
R Markdown allows you to generate documents of all types (reports, presentations, books, etc.) with embedded R code and outputs (plots, tables, figures etc.).

> ? Who is this for
This introduction is appropriate for anyone with a general interest in R and R Markdown.

>? Prerequisites
Prior knowledge in R programming language is recommended but not necessary.
Attendees are expected to have the most recent version of R and RStudio installed on their own computers, along with the following packages and their dependencies.

`install.packages(c("tidyverse","knitr","rmarkdown"))`

Here are links to free downloads for R (https://cran.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download).

> ? When
Monday, 28 December from 5.00pm - 6.30 pm ( Time Zone - GMT+5.30, India)

> ? Where
We'll be live on Zoom.

Join Zoom Meeting
https://learn.zoom.us/j/66645976860?pwd=MkhQMVhvdWFRdlQ1UWVEUXZDanN2Zz09

Meeting ID: 666 4597 6860
Passcode: e$%0NKL2

> ? Agenda
5.00 - 5.15 pm : Who we are? | Meet & Greet | Networking
5.15 - 6.15 pm : Workshop on "R Markdown - ON YOUR MARKS, GET SET,
GO!"
6.15 - 6.30 pm : Discussion with audience on questions / resources |
More Networking | Wrap up

To ensure a safe, enjoyable, and friendly experience for everyone who participates, we follow the R-Ladies International Code of Conduct here: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

> ? speakers and event organizers

Thiyanga S. Talagala
Check out her work at: https://thiyanga.netlify.app/
and
Priyanga D. Talagala
Check out her work at: http://prital.netlify.com/

title: Hierarchical Forecasting of Dengue Incidence in Sri Lanka
description:
Hello, R enthusiasts!!!
Dengue is the most rapidly growing mosquito-borne viral infection in the world. This talk presents a hierarchical approach for time series forecasting using R. This is joint work with Dr Thiyanga S. Talagala

> ? Speaker
Samudra Madushani, University of Sri Jayewardenepura, Sri Lanka
Check out his work at:
https://darecentre.org.au/portfolio_page/samudra-madushani/

> ? Who is this for
This introduction is appropriate for anyone with a general interest in R and data science.

>? Prerequisites
Prior knowledge in R programming language is recommended but not necessary.

> ?when
22 December, 2021 from 5.00 pm (Time Zone - GMT+5.30, India)

> ?where
We'll be live on Zoom.
Zoom link :

Time: Dec 22, 2021 05:00 PM India

Join Zoom Meeting

Meeting ID: 695 4682 8234
Passcode: WAK1Qv.D

> ?Agenda

- 40 min: Workshop on "Hierarchical Forecasting of Dengue Incidence in Sri Lanka"
- 10 min: Discussion with the audience on questions/resources | More Networking | Wrap up

To ensure a safe, enjoyable, and friendly experience for everyone who participates, we follow the R-Ladies International Code of Conduct here: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

title: Data Wrangling with R
description:
Hello, R enthusiasts!!!

Do you know that data wrangling costs analytics professionals as much as 80% of their time, leaving only 20% for exploration and modeling? Come join us in our upcoming meet-up "Data wrangling with R" to learn tools in R that make data wrangling fun and easy!!!

> ? Speaker
Janith Wanniarachchi, University of Sri Jayewardenepura, Sri Lanka
Check out his work at:
https://janithwanni.netlify.app/

> ? Who is this for
This introduction is appropriate for anyone with a general interest in R and data science.

>? Prerequisites
Prior knowledge in R programming language is recommended but not necessary. Attendees are expected to have the most recent version of R and RStudio installed on their own computers.

Here are links to free downloads for R (https://cran.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download).

> ?when
22 April, 2021 from 5.00 pm (Time Zone - GMT+5.30, India)

title: Machine Learning in R
description:
Hello, R enthusiasts!!!

Do you want to do machine learning using R, but you’re having trouble getting started?

Come join us in our upcoming meet-up “Machine Learning in R”

> ? Speaker
Dr. Kasun Bandara, University of Melbourne, Australia

>? Who is this for
This introduction is appropriate for anyone with a general interest in R and Machine Learning.

> ? Prerequisites
Prior knowledge in R programming language and machine learning is recommended but not necessary. Attendees are expected to have the most recent version of R and RStudio installed on their own computers.

Here are links to free downloads for R (https://cran.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download).

title: Around the world in 30 minutes (Map Creation with R)
description:

Would you like to explore and communicate the geographic distribution of your data? Let's do it with choropleths and alternative map creation in R !!!

title: Plot a lot with ggplot2 to find plots
description:
Hello, R enthusiasts!!!
Would you like to tell your data story with compelling visuals?
Let's do it with ggplot2 !!!

Come join us in our upcoming meet-up "Plot a lot with ggplot2 to find plots"

> ?ggplot2
R package, ggplot2 is dedicated to data visualization and is based on "The Grammar of Graphics".

> ? Who is this for
This introduction is appropriate for anyone with a general interest in R and data visualization.

>? Prerequisites
Prior knowledge in R programming language is recommended but not necessary.
Attendees are expected to have the most recent version of R and RStudio installed on their own computers, along with the following packages and their dependencies.

`install.packages(c("tidyverse","palmerpenguins"))`

Here are links to free downloads for R (https://cran.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download).

> ?when
Monday, 27 January, 2021 from 5.00pm - 6.30 pm ( Time Zone - GMT+5.30, India)

title: From Zero Lines to Endless Code:  Non-Coder to Coder Transformation
description:
**Who is this for?**

Anyone who has the tiniest interest in a programming language. Especially those who fear taking the first step to write a simple line of code.

**Prerequisites**

Prior knowledge of R programming is not required. This will be a non-technical session to motivate young individuals who are interested in a career related to Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science and Data Analytics.

**Type:**
This is a free online event. The Zoom link will be provided to registered participants via Meetup 10 minutes before the scheduled meeting time."
